result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Osvatic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas A Osvatic is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas A Osvatic was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution set in the amount of $546.33 to the victim Jennifer L. to be paid through the attorney's trust account.

*Serve 6 months in the Day Reporting Center, with credit for ZERO days time served. Sentence can be served with Huber Privileges for VA hospital and other release privileges to be determined by DRC. Can be served on Electronic monitoring. Court stayed the commencement until 07/31/15.
*Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.
*If defendant is noncompliance with Day Reporting Center than court ordered sentence to be straight time in the House of Correction.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Osvatic

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas A Osvatic not in court, defendant in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 If defendant is in noncompliance with Day reporting Center than court ordered sentence to be straight time in the House of Correction. lr

Defendant Nicholas A Osvatic in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve SIX MONTHS in the Day Reporting Center, with credit for ZERO days time served.   SENTENCE CAN BE SERVED  with Huber privileges for VA hospital and other release privileges to be determine by DRC. Can be served on Electronic monitoring.  Court stayed the commencment until 7-31-15. 
By stipulation of the parties restitution set in the amount of $546.33 to the victim Jennifer L. to be paid  through  the attorney's trust account. 
Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Nicholas A Osvatic in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT TWO: 


Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

OIN MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT ONE:  DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING. 

 Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
State filed motion in limine;witness list and proposed jury instructions.

Defendant Nicholas A Osvatic in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 47
Court ordered case adjourned for  final pretrial on 6-30-15 at 8:30 and jury trial in Branch 47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas A Osvatic in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court orderred stayed bench warrant cancelled.

Attorney Christina E. Balistreri in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, defendant currently in inpatient treatment.  Court  continued the stay on the  bench warrant  until 5-20-15 at 8:30 in branch 47. lr  Calendar call scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 4-23-15 at 8:30 in branch 47. lr

Attorney  C. Balistreri for Christopher Lee Hartley in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 4-23-15 at 8:30 in branch 47. lr
  Calendar call scheduled for 04-23-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas A Osvatic in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Hartley in earlier. Defendant arrived late. 

Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch  47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-08-2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JL.

Defendant Nicholas A Osvatic in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (02-12-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
